title: Nate Diaz appears to claim he's failed drugs test and puts UFC career in doubt with statement
text:

Nate Diaz has released an explosive statement blasting the UFC and USADA (US Anti-Doping Agency) in which he appeared to claim he had failed a drugs test.

Diaz is due to take on Jorge Masvidal in UFC 244 in New York next weekend but has now said he is "not gonna make it out to NYC for fight week".

He claims to have been told he tested positive for "elevated levels" that may have been a result of "tainted supplements".

Diaz categorically denies the allegations.

Conor McGregor's former opponent stated he will not be competing until the issue is fully resolved and his name is fully cleared.

He signed off his statement by seemingly throwing his career in doubt with "so fight game, I'll see you when I see you".

(Image: Zuffa LLC)

Diaz posted the statement alongside the caption "Your all on steroids not me" on social media.

The statement read: "I'm not gonna make it out to NYC for fight week next week because they say I tested with elevated levels that they say might be from some tainted supplements.

"I call false on that cause I only take whole food or natural food supplements. I don't even eat meat.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

"So until UFC, USADA or whoever is f****** with me fixes it, I won't be competing.

"I'm not gonna play their game and try and hide it or keep quiet, as they suggested.

"I'm not gonna have my name tainted as a cheater like these other mother******* who keep quiet until after the fight just so that they can get paid. F***** cheaters.

"I don't give a f*** about some money over my dignity and my legacy. I'm not playing along with this bull****.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

"I'm not staying quiet and figuring it out after the fight. That's cheating.

"So fight game I'll see you when I see you.

"Sincerely, the realest baddest mother f***** in the fight game."

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

Diaz has twice been beaten by rival Conor McGregor in the past, but the Irishman announced his comeback on Thursday and claimed he wants to fight the winner of Diaz vs Masvidal, which is now in jeopardy.

Outlining the second fight of his three-fight comeback plan, McGregor said: “I will then look to compete against the winner of Nate Diaz and Jorge Masvidal. Obviously, I have history with Nate Diaz, we are set to have the trilogy bout.

“We’ll see how that one goes, I feel Nate will get the better of that one and then we will contest the trilogy bout."
description: Conor McGregor's former rival Nate Diaz has thrown his career into doubt with an explosive statement
